title: Lake Clark National Park & Preserve: Changing Tides Blog
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Research & Monitoring     Changing Tides: Bear & Clam Research     Changing Tides Blog                Changing Tides: Brown Bear Research in Southwest Alaska       RSS  About This Blog Changing Tides is a three-year project in the Alaska Peninsula investigating the relationships between coastal brown bears, people and marine intertidal invertebrates such as mussels and clams.   Expedition to Polly Creek  July 27, 2015 Posted by: Sam Stark  0 Comments     We’ve come to Polly Creek for the same reason people have come to this remote coast of Lake Clark National Park for almost 100 years: It is loaded with razor clams. Unlike the other boats full sport fisherman and commercial clammers landing on the beach today, however, we aren’t here to harvest, we are here to study. Our work is part of the Changing Tides Project, a multi-year study looking at the link between coastal brown bears and marine intertidal invertebrates.
